intro: Gonolobus marginatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many climbing and trailing plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, white, tubular flowers that bloom at night. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, orange aril. Due to its nocturnal blooming habit and unique floral structure, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
